meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inanimate.
meanings.sent1: The inanimateness of the rock made it impossible for it to move on its own.
meanings.sent2: The inanimateness of the statue gave it a sense of calm and stillness.
meanings.sent3: The inanimateness of the toy car made it the perfect candidate for a race with the real cars.
meanings.sent4: The inanimateness of the painting seemed to capture a moment frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The inanimateness of the robot made it seem almost lifelike in its movements.

meanings.definition: The lack of life or vitality.
meanings.sent1: The garden's inanimateness in winter was a stark contrast to its vibrant colors in spring.
meanings.sent2: The inanimateness of the desert landscape was broken only by the occasional tumbleweed.
meanings.sent3: The inanimateness of the party was quickly lifted by the arrival of the lively band.
meanings.sent4: The inanimateness of the old house seemed to absorb all the energy of its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The inanimateness of the room was so eerie, it felt like a scene from a horror movie.
